description:
Chocobo GP is a kart racing game developed and published by Square Enix for the Nintendo Switch. It was released worldwide in March 2022.

The game features characters from the Final Fantasy series racing around tracks based on locations from various Final Fantasy games. Players can choose from over 30 characters including main protagonists like Cloud Strife, Lightning, Noctis and more. There are also chocobos and moogles as playable racers.

The gameplay is similar to Mario Kart with items that can be used to disrupt opponents or gain advantages. However, Chocobo GP adds some new mechanics like "summon magic" that players can activate to get a temporary speed boost. There are also tracks with multiple paths that provide strategic options for shortcuts.

There are both single player and multiplayer modes available. The single player mode includes a Grand Prix circuit as well as time trials and boss battles. For multiplayer, up to 8 players can compete locally or online in races and battle modes. Customization options are available to upgrade karts and choose different cosmetic items for racers.

Overall, the reviews for Chocobo GP have been mixed. The positives include the familiar kart racing gameplay, variety of tracks and characters from the Final Fantasy series, and decent graphics for a Switch game. However, critics have complained about the lack of new ideas, low difficulty, and few gameplay modes.

In summary, Chocobo GP is an enjoyable kart racer for Final Fantasy and kart racing fans looking for some nostalgic fun. However, it does not offer much in the way of innovation for the genre and may feel a bit shallow for some players. But for fans of the Chocobo and other Final Fantasy characters, the opportunity to race them around iconic locations from the series could make Chocobo GP worth checking out.
